definition: clown/2nd earthly branch: 1-3 a.m., 12th solar month (6th January to 3rd February), year of the Ox/ancient Chinese compass point: 30°

sentences.english: He suffered a loss of prestige when the scandal was publicized .
sentences.chinese: 这件丑事公开后他便威信扫地。

sentences.english: Since this man is my guest, don't do this disgraceful thing.
sentences.chinese: 这人既然进了我的家，你们就不要行这丑事。

sentences.english: 1：We spent weeks trying to dig up dirt on this guy.
sentences.chinese: 我们几星期来都在竭力挖那家伙的丑事。

sentences.english: Melvin has even managed to dig up some dirt on the inscrutable Pyongyang Metro —that’s the system’s Puhung station in the photo.
sentences.chinese: 梅尔文甚至还挖掘出了平壤地铁的一点丑事。

sentences.english: Those who avoid great sins and shameful deeds, only (falling into) small faults, - verily thy Lord is ample in forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 远离大罪和丑事，但犯小罪者，你的主确是宽宥的。

sentences.english: The whole village knew about the scandal.
sentences.chinese: 全村人都知道那件丑事了。

sentences.english: It would be a scandal to leave diagnosed patients without treatment".
sentences.chinese: 将病人诊断出来而不加治疗是一件丑事。

sentences.english: You don't want to hush-hush his scandal to me.
sentences.chinese: 你别想对我隐瞒他的丑事。

sentences.english: The villagers knew about the scandal.
sentences.chinese: 村子里的居民知道这件丑事。

sentences.english: The media for their folly to question the imperial palace fee?
sentences.chinese: 媒体质疑故宫为掩丑事给封口费？

sentences.english: The public has an appetite for scandal.
sentences.chinese: 公众对丑事总是喜闻乐道。

definition: bad record (esp. of a public official)/unsavory track record
lit. family shames must not be spread abroad (idiom)/fig. don't wash your dirty linen in public
pinyin: jia1 chou3 bu4 ke3 wai4 yang2

definition: lit. wind and rain sweeping through the town (idiom)/fig. a big scandal/an uproar/the talk of the town
to have no sense of shame/brazen
disgraceful (of behavior that is unfilial, rebellious or otherwise in grave breach of the norms of society)
